other_tests.findings: 3.3 liters of ascitic fluid removed; serumâ€“ascites albumin gradient was 1.2 g per deciliter.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Reaccumulation of ascites was noted three days later.

other_tests.findings: Microscopical examination showed evidence of venous outflow obstruction, suggestive of partial or incomplete cirrhosis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Comparative analysis showed different levels of fibrosis; original biopsy revealed bridging fibrosis suggesting incomplete cirrhosis, whereas a later biopsy showed absent bridging fibrosis.

other_tests.findings: Coarse, echogenic liver with mild ascites; hepatic veins were not well visualized.
Demonstrated narrowing of the intrahepatic portion of the inferior vena cava.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Hepatic veins could not be visualized.

other_tests.findings: Presence of V617F mutation in JAK2; 20 to 30 percent of peripheral-blood nucleated cells harbor the mutant allele.
